fields.headline: Morgan's Reds bid fails again
fields.bodyText: Liverpool have rejected the latest bid from Steve Morgan to inject significant capital into the club, a scheme that would have effectively seen the building tycoon take control. The club's hierarchy had accepted proposals for a £70m share purchase from Morgan after more than a month of negotiations. Yet he revised that offer after checks during the process of due diligence suggested the cost of the proposed new stadium in Stanley Park had risen significantly. He then submitted a £70m package that would have placed around £50m directly at the club's disposal. But agreement could not be reached as to how the £70m would be split between the club and shareholders.
